newsitem.title: UK: Commodity turnover to rise shortly on LIFFE - Sucden.
newsitem.headline: Commodity turnover to rise shortly on LIFFE - Sucden.

text.p: Turnover and awareness of London commodity markets will increase substantially even before financial and commodity futures are co-housed under the new LIFFE banner, Michael Overlander, managing director at UK brokers Sucden said on Monday.

"A year from now there will be a marked improvement in the volumes compared to today and that will be due to LIFFE's (London's International Finanical Futures and Options Exchange) imput, whether or not we are co-housed," Overlander said.

The 40-year old London Commodity Exchange (LCE) and the fast-paced LIFFE exchanges officially merged on Monday, creating the only organisation in the world to trade a complete range of financial, agricultural, soft and equity futures and options.
The merger of the two exchanges was secured after LIFFE offered 10.3 million stg for the LCE.
"LIFFE has a heck of a lot to show us (commodity markets)," Overlander said adding that since LIFFE was founded its volumes have soared whilst volumes in commodity trading have fallen.
"LIFFE has demonstrated to the whole world that they know how to run a decent and hugely successful exchange," he added.
